intro: Pleroma argenteum, commonly known as the silver pleroma, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its silver-gray foliage and showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from white to pale pink. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and xeriscaping. Due to its ornamental value and adaptability, it is often cultivated in regions with mild winters.
